1:
Tell Yahweh that you thank him very much for the good things that he has done for you!\q2 He faithfully loves us, his people, forever.
\q1
2:
You Israelite people should repeatedly shout,\q2 "He faithfully loves us, his people, forever!"


\q1
3:
You priests who are descendants of Aaron should repeatedly shout,\q2 "He faithfully loves us, his people, forever!"
\q1
4:
All you who revere him should repeatedly shout,\q2 "He faithfully loves us, his people, forever!"



\q1
5:
When I was distressed, I called out to Yahweh,\q2 and he answered me and set me free from my worries.
\q1
6:
Yahweh is on my side,\q2 so I will not be afraid of anything.
\q2 No one can do anything that will prevent God from blessing me forever.
\q1
7:
Yes, Yahweh is on my side,\q2 so I will look triumphantly at my enemies while he defeats them.



\q1
8:
It is better to trust in Yahweh\q2 than to depend on people.
\q1
9:
It is better to trust Yahweh to protect us\q2 than to trust that influential people will protect us.



\q1
10:
Armies of many nations surrounded us,\q2 but Yahweh enabled us to defeat them by his power.
\q1
11:
They completely surrounded us,\q2 but we defeated them all by Yahweh's power.
\q1
12:
They swarmed around me like angry bees;\q2 they were like a fire that flares up in a thornbush,
\q2 but we defeated them by Yahweh's power.



\q1
13:
Our enemies attacked us fiercely and almost defeated us,\q2 but Yahweh helped us.
\q1
15:
Listen to the joyful songs of victory being sung in the tents of the people who honor God!\q2 They sing, "Yahweh has defeated our enemies by his mighty power;
\q1
16:
he has raised his strong right arm to show he is happy over defeating his enemies.\q2 Yahweh has completely defeated them!"



\q1
17:
I will not be killed in battle;\q2 I will live to proclaim the great things that Yahweh has done.
\q1
18:
Yahweh has punished me severely,\q2 but he has not allowed me to die.



\q1
19:
You gatekeepers, open for me the gates of the temple\q2 so that I may enter and thank Yahweh.
\q1
20:
Those are the gates through which we enter the temple to worship Yahweh;\q2 those who honor God enter through those gates.
\q1
21:
Yahweh, I thank you that you answered my prayer\q2 and that you saved me from my enemies.



\q1
22:
Yahweh's chosen king is like a stone that the builders rejected\q2 when they were building a house,
\q1 but that stone became the cornerstone.
\q1
23:
This was done by Yahweh,\q1 and it is a wonderful thing for us to see.


\q1
24:
This is the day on which we remember that Yahweh acted powerfully to defeat our enemies;\q2 we will rejoice and be glad today.
\q1
25:
Yahweh, we plead with you to keep rescuing us from our enemies.\q2 Yahweh, please help us accomplish what we want to do.


\q1
26:
Yahweh, bless the one who will come with your power.\q2 From the temple we bless all of you.
\q1
27:
Yahweh is God,\q2 and he has caused his light to come to us.
\q1 Come, bring animal sacrifice and tie it to the horns of the altar.
\q1
28:
Yahweh, you are the God whom I worship, and I will praise you!\q2 You are my God, and I will tell everyone that you are great!



\q1
29: Thank Yahweh because he does good things for us!\q2 He will faithfully love us forever as he has promised.
